definition: To identify and determine the nature or cause of a medical condition or disease, typically through a systematic examination and analysis of symptoms, medical history, and diagnostic tests. This term is commonly employed in the field of healthcare and medicine.

examples.german: Der Arzt konnte die Krankheit diagnostizieren.
examples.english: The doctor was able to diagnose the illness.

examples.german: Der Psychologe hat eine psychische St√∂rung diagnostiziert.
examples.english: The psychologist diagnosed a mental disorder.

examples.german: Der Mechaniker konnte das Problem diagnostizieren und beheben.
examples.english: The mechanic was able to diagnose and fix the problem.

examples.german: Der Tierarzt hat eine Infektion bei dem Hund diagnostiziert.
examples.english: The veterinarian diagnosed an infection in the dog.
